question: A medical center has a capacity of 1600 rooms with 1/16 occupied. Due to the pandemic, 95 patients are admitted into the medical center each day. Calculate the total number of unoccupied rooms in the medical center after 2 weeks.
answer:
If 1/16 of the total capacity of the medical center rooms is occupied, it means 1/16 * 1600 = <<1600*1/16=100>>100 rooms have patients using them.
The total number of rooms in the medical center without new admissions is 1600 rooms - 100 rooms = <<1600-100=1500>>1500 rooms.
If 95 people are admitted each day, the total number of patients in the medical center after one week is 95 patients/day * 7 days/week = 665 patients.
After 2 weeks, the total number of patients admitted into the medical center is 665 patients/week * 2 weeks = <<665*2=1330>>1330 patients, who each use one room.
If there were 1500 unoccupied rooms in the medical center before the new admissions, the total number is reduced to 1500 rooms - 1330 rooms = <<1500-1330=170>>170 unoccupied rooms.
#### 170
